qualifiedName.description: The fully qualified name of the property. e.g. io.acryl.datahub.myProperty

displayName.description: The display name of the property. This is the name that will be shown in the UI and can be used to look up the property id.

valueType.description:
The value type of the property. Must be a dataType.
e.g. To indicate that the property is of type DATE, use urn:li:dataType:datahub.date

typeQualifier.description:
A map that allows for type specialization of the valueType.
e.g. a valueType of urn:li:dataType:datahub.urn
can be specialized to be a USER or GROUP URN by adding a typeQualifier like 
{ "allowedTypes": ["urn:li:entityType:datahub.corpuser", "urn:li:entityType:datahub.corpGroup"] }

allowedValues.description:
A list of allowed values that the property is allowed to take. 
If this is not specified, then the property can take any value of given type.

cardinality.description: The cardinality of the property. If not specified, then the property is assumed to be single valued..

description.description: The description of the property. This is the description that will be shown in the UI.

searchConfiguration.description:
Search configuration for this property. If not specified, then the property is indexed using the default mapping.
from the logical type.

immutable.description: Whether the structured property value is immutable once applied to an entity.

version.description:
Definition version - Allows breaking schema changes. String is compared case-insensitive and new
                     versions must be monotonically increasing. Cannot use periods/dots.
                     Suggestions: v1, v2
                                  20240610, 20240611

description.description: Optional description of the property value

DataHubSearchConfig.description: Configuration for how any given field should be indexed and matched in the DataHub search index.

fieldName.description: Name of the field in the search index. Defaults to the field name otherwise

fieldType.description: Type of the field. Defines how the field is indexed and matched

queryByDefault.description: Whether we should match the field for the default search query

enableAutocomplete.description: Whether we should use the field for default autocomplete

addToFilters.description: Whether or not to add field to filters.

addHasValuesToFilters.description:
Whether or not to add the "has values" to filters.
check if this is conditional on addToFilters being true

hasValuesFilterNameOverride.description: Display name of the has values filter

boostScore.description: Boost multiplier to the match score. Matches on fields with higher boost score ranks higher

hasValuesFieldName.description: If set, add a index field of the given name that checks whether the field exists

numValuesFieldName.description: If set, add a index field of the given name that checks the number of elements

weightsPerFieldValue.description: (Optional) Weights to apply to score for a given value

fieldNameAliases.description: (Optional) Aliases for this given field that can be used for sorting etc.

AuditStamp.description: Data captured on a resource/association/sub-resource level giving insight into when that resource/association/sub-resource moved into a particular lifecycle stage, and who acted to move it into that specific lifecycle stage.

time.description: When did the resource/association/sub-resource move into the specific lifecycle stage represented by this AuditEvent.

actor.description: The entity (e.g. a member URN) which will be credited for moving the resource/association/sub-resource into the specific lifecycle stage. It is also the one used to authorize the change.

impersonator.description: The entity (e.g. a service URN) which performs the change on behalf of the Actor and must be authorized to act as the Actor.

message.description: Additional context around how DataHub was informed of the particular change. For example: was the change created by an automated process, or manually.
